alert.note: Alert for Grant; La Salle; Winn (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 11 at 11:29AM CDT until May 11 at 11:45AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN GRANT...SOUTHWESTERN CALDWELL...LA SALLE AND EASTERN WINN PARISHES... At 1129 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Clarks to near Olla to 16 miles west of Midway, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Jena, Olla, Clarks, Grayson, Midway, Urania, Tullos, Georgetown, Sikes, Nebo, Spaulding, Standard, Rochelle, Kelly, Zenoria, Burlington and Williana. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for north central Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
